alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wake and southwestern Franklin Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 444 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Wake Forest, or 7 miles northeast of Raleigh, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Falls Lake, Bunn, Knightdale and Rolesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Boaters on the open water and those camping outdoors are especially vulnerable to the dangers of lightning. Seek harbor immediately and find safe shelter in a nearby building or vehicle.
